definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: In other words, learning spontaneously is one of man's unique traits.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，自动自发的学习是人类的独特性质之一。

sentences.english: Perceiving people tend to be more spontaneous, sometimes careless.
sentences.chinese: 理解性的人比较自动自发，有时不小心。

sentences.english: Beware of a theology produced by spontaneous generation.
sentences.chinese: 留心这自动自发的世代生出的神学。

sentences.english: Automatic spontaneous child to go over the ends of the earth to be popular everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 自动自发的孩子就是走遍海角天涯都处处受欢迎。

definition: readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
